| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | [SpliceHack v1.2.0 - monst.c, line 3595](https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.2.0/src/monst.c#L3595) |

A **drow**, @, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"). The drow is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous") type of [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") that is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") to their kind - male drow are known as **hedrow**. Drow will pick up and use various items, and are capable of [flanking](/index.php?title=Flanking\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Flanking (page does not exist)") in combat.

A drow has two weapon attacks, and possesses [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") like other elves.

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a drow [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 2⁄5 chance (40%) of conveying sleep resistance.

## Generation

Randomly generated drow are always created [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile"), and may appear in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). They are not a valid form for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

## Strategy

As elven monsters, eating their corpse or tin constitutes cannibalism for elven and drow characters; other characters will find drow corpses to be a useful source of sleep resistance and a decent source of nutrition.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Drow_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit)*

Drow (SpliceHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ drow
Difficulty 9
Attacks Weapon 2d4 physical, Weapon 2d4 physical
@ drow
Difficulty 9
Attacks

Weapon 2d4 physical, Weapon 2d4 physical

Base level 6
Base experience 89
Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 60
Alignment −9 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 800
Nutritional value 350
Size Medium
Resistances sleep
Resistances conveyed sleep (40%)

A drow:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is an elf.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • normally appears in small groups.
Reference SpliceHack v1.2.0 - monst.c, line 3595

A drow, @, is a type of monster that appears in SpliceHack. The drow is a strong and omnivorous type of elf that is a lord to their kind - male drow are known as hedrow. Drow will pick up and use various items, and are capable of flanking in combat.

A drow has two weapon attacks, and possesses sleep resistance like other elves.

Eating a drow corpse or tin has a 2⁄5 chance (40%) of conveying sleep resistance.

Generation

Randomly generated drow are always created hostile, and may appear in small groups. They are not a valid form for polymorph.

Strategy

As elven monsters, eating their corpse or tin constitutes cannibalism for elven and drow characters; other characters will find drow corpses to be a useful source of sleep resistance and a decent source of nutrition.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''drow''', {{monsym|drow}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SpliceHack]]. The drow is a [[strong]] and [[omnivorous]] type of [[Elf (monster attribute)|elf]] that is a [[M2_LORD|lord]] to their kind - male drow are known as '''hedrow'''. Drow will pick up and use various items, and are capable of [[flanking]] in combat.

A drow has two weapon attacks, and possesses [[sleep resistance]] like other elves.

[[Eating]] a drow [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a {{frac|2|5}} chance (40%) of conveying sleep resistance.

==Generation==
Randomly generated drow are always created [[hostile]], and may appear in small [[group]]s. They are not a valid form for [[polymorph]].

==Strategy==
As elven monsters, eating their corpse or tin constitutes cannibalism for elven and drow characters; other characters will find drow corpses to be a useful source of sleep resistance and a decent source of nutrition.
